summary: This is a domestic witness travel request form from the SDNY Victim/Witness Unit, dated August 5, 2021, for a fact witness to appear in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The witness is scheduled for trial preparation on August 16-17, 2021, and requires hotel accommodations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the witness travel request.

persons.name: Ed Tyrrell
persons.context: Mentioned in the instructions section as a contact for guidance on witness travel funding for investigative interviews.

events.title: Witness Trial Preparation Session
events.description: A fact witness is scheduled to appear in the SDNY at 1 PM for trial preparation in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Witness Trial Preparation Session (Day 2)
events.description: The fact witness is scheduled to appear again at 10 AM for continued trial preparation.

keyFacts: A fact witness was scheduled for trial preparation in the Ghislaine Maxwell case on August 16-17, 2021.
The witness travel was authorized under the FEWS appropriation specifically for grand jury testimony, court testimony, or preparation for same.
The witness was not a victim-witness, not facing criminal charges, and resided within the continental United States.
The document references DOJ Instruction 1300.01.01 as governing policy for witness travel.
The witness's identity is protected in this form, with only travel logistics and case details provided.
